lexUnit.name: detect.v

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: discern (something intangible or barely perceptible)

sentence.text: Again , a situation in which the animal detects that there is danger , or suspects that there might be danger , is something which we need to take account of in considering the welfare of animals .
` Really , Mr Newman , " Hauser waved his cigarette , but again Newman had detected that brief flicker behind the pince-nez .
Quickly his canine smell sense detected that the trail was stronger on the inward line .
I detect that some doubts still remain .
Any animal that could detect these waves would have a reliable indicator of weather changes ahead .
Gagn√© has provided a formula by which we may detect what is missing from a student 's repertoire .
However , a scorpion can detect air moving at 0.072 kilometres per hour -- 100 times slower than a light breeze on the Beaufort scale .
At Rollright circle , Graves was able to detect energy jumping from stone to stone .
They were trotting along a path on the side of a hill when they detected a man walking below them .
` Tut-tut , do I detect someone fishing for compliments ? " he asked .
Sara detected something unusual in Tawell 's attitude .
Then , using sensitive equipment in a laboratory , scientists found that pigeons can detect sounds as low as 0.1 hertz -- that is , one vibration every ten seconds .
The sounds they produce in their larynx may reach as far up the ultrasonic scale as 200 000 hertz , allowing them to detect objects as tiny as a midget 20 metres away .
We may detect his private opinion only at one point .
Fish are likely to have been able to detect sound from a very early period .
Sybil wrinkled her nose as if she had suddenly detected a smell from the drains .
Diane asked , and Reynolds detected a slight anxiety in her voice .
We detected a faint diesel odour in the accommodation during our visit .
I think I detect straws in the wind that point in that direction .
` Do I detect a wistful note in your voice ?
I thought I detected a faint smile on his lips , but I did not smile back because my heart was in a turmoil .
I thought I detected a smirk on the face of Mills Roberts .
Holman could almost detect an embittered smile on the pain-wracked face .
The male is able to detect this sound with an eardrum at the base of his antennae , which vibrate in sympathy with this one frequency , and so fly towards her .
` Do I detect a desire for retribution against me , sweet Gina ? "
Then she lifted her great eyes to his and he thought he detected a mixture of fleeting emotions : resolution , appeal , defiance .
So I lied and said I detected nothing untoward in finding a bullet-riddled boat awash in the Bahamian seas .
Nevertheless , Freud did detect a providential , protective element in the superego .
` Do I detect a note of irony ? " asked Antony cheerfully .
How can one detect the early signs of relapse ?
Support for ` neutrality " was also detected in Turkey .
Organisms can also be detected in food .
Nowadays few people can detect this very slight disability although I tend to limp a bit if I get tired .
Yet we did detect an easing off in harassment of Republicans and of itinerants .
This was the aporia detected by Merleau-Ponty : but rather than question Marxism 's truth , Sartre sought to remove its indetermination .
I could not detect from his tone what Jean-Claude felt about what he was saying .
` Do I detect from your tone , Chief Superintendent , that you think us a couple of queers ?
He displayed that strange other-worldliness that I have sometimes detected in other people who follow some strict religious code .
Was that boredom she could detect in his voice ?
But any bias they detect on television is inflicted upon them by what seems like a television news cartel .
The females of some moths produce an odour that the males can detect with large feathery antennae .
When you return you are able to detect under which cup the coin is placed .
Glancing back through what I have written so far , I detect more than a note of cynicism .
Bernice thought she detected more than a suggestion of injured pride in his rigid stance .
We thought we detected more than a hint of irony in this answer , and we suspected that they were smugglers .
The biters are usually the easiest to detect because they eat away the foliage .
Sin detected can contrive all manner of veils to cover its nakedness .
Harry said , detecting as he spoke the strain of exasperation in his voice .
In February 2004 , it was revealed that HEU traces detected by IAEA inspectors twelve months previously -- in at least two different sites -- were pure enough to produce nuclear weaponry .
QN : Do Russia 's chemical weapons facilities have systems to detect the accidental release of chemical weapons ?

It was certain from the first , however , that they would eventually be detected , as the cook , from the evidence of one or two tradespeople who have caught a glimpse of him through the window , was a man of most remarkable appearance - being a huge and hideous mulatto , with yellowish features of a pronounced negroid type .
This man has been seen since the crime , for he was detected and pursued by Constable Walters on the same evening , when he had the audacity to revisit Wisteria Lodge .
